translation: zmora [something that is particularly effective in causing you trouble or worry]
sentence: Instead of doing his homework, my son is always playing computer games – they’re the bane of my existence these days.
Federer has a wide repertoire of clever shots that befuddle even the best of his opponents.

translation: solanka [water with salt in it, especially when used to preserve food]
sentence: Vessels similar to this one were once used to carry water and brine.
The sauces are made of several ingredients including chili, onion, red and green tomatoes, and coriander.

translation: łom [a heavy iron bar with a bent end that is used to help lift heavy objects off the ground or to force things open]
sentence: The thieves forced one of the windows open with a crowbar.

translation: rozmontować [to take apart a machine or structure so that it is in separate pieces]
sentence: She dismantled the washing machine to see what the problem was, but couldn't put it back together again.

translation: drzemać [to have a short sleep, especially during the day]
sentence: My cat likes dozing in front of the fire.

translation: upokorzenie [the feeling of being ashamed or losing respect for yourself, or an occasion when you have this feeling]
sentence: Imagine the humiliation of having to apologize.

translation: podkradać, zwędzić [to steal things of little value or in small quantities, especially from the place where you work]
sentence: She regularly pilfered stamps from work.

translation: pryszcz, krosta [a small raised area on the skin that contains pus]
sentence: It is as useless as applying face powder to the pustules in a case of smallpox.

translation: redagować [to remove words or information from a text before it is printed or made available to the public]
sentence: Officers' names are routinely redacted from any publicly released reports.

translation: wykręcać się, wymigać się [to avoid work, duties, or responsibilities, especially if they are difficult or unpleasant]
sentence: He has never shirked from taking on the big issues.

translation: wzniesienie, zbocze [a surface or piece of land that is high at one end and low at the other]
sentence: There's a very steep slope just before you reach the top of the mountain.

translation: przesądny, zabobonny [believing that particular objects or events are lucky or unlucky]
sentence: Some people are superstitious about spilling salt on the table.

translation: klapa w podłodze [a small door in a ceiling or floor]
sentence: There's a trapdoor into the attic.
